_header: Of Agamemnon under the large empire born in Athens
Subjects: Giles, saint, life of; saints’ lives; envoys
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Life of St. Giles’, including a prayer to that saint and envoy — forty-six 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Of agamenoun vnder the large Empyreborn in athenys of grekis regall
                    lyne…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…yif thou be mene we stonde no thyng in wereto haue his mercy
                    þat bouhte us with his blood
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: Here begynneth the lyff of seynt Gyle (f. 33v)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 161-73.

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Off Agamenoun vnder the large Empireborn in Athenys of grekys Roial
                    lyne…
BLHar2255.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden: Neue Folge.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1881: 371.

BLLan699.First Lines:
…Bi a spiryt oonly of prophecieKnewh biforn whan thou
                    sholdist passe…
BLLan699.Last Lines:
…Yiff thou be mene we stond nothyng in weereTo haue his mercy
                    that bouht vs with his blood
BLLan699.Note:
Last 6 stanzas only. Folio number reflects the most recent
                    foliation.
